data.title: Fun Place
data.text: Come here for the atmosphere and the drink of choice.  Mine was an old fashioned, tasty!   The time spent on details, like the flag made out of fire hose, and the wood burned fire station logos on the tables, made the decor personal and inviting.  The owner definitely put his heart into this!

data.title: Cool place
data.text: Newer distillery in the area. The old town area is cute and could use a facelift and this place really helps. The drinks were great & the bartenders were friendly. Would recommend the tour! You get a lot of booze :) give it a try!

data.title: Amazing old fire station : Remodel
data.text: Back in the 1970s, I used to live in the old town Peoria area. I would often walk to and from work from my home located near 83rd & Peoria Av.  I would pass by this delightful old fire station which was the original fire station  #  1.  -- It had that olé time unique look about it as it stood there in town. Recently this distilling company purchased and remodeled the old fire building. - What a unique display of architecture revised. --Benches, bar stools, & the bar made of beautiful wood ... Original fire hoses & firemen's uniforms decorated the walls . --- We went on the tour of the distilling area and was given a very nice  informative talk about how they use this area. We were given the history of the fire station as well.  Plus we were even given samples of their products. It was quite fun to go back down memory lane of this  old station turned new ... I would recommend Lucidi,  just for the fun of it !

data.title: Great new hangout
data.text: Took my wife on the tour for her birthday and she loved it ! They called her by name when she walked in which made her feel welcome. The ladies behind the bar were very knowledgeable about their product and seemed to enjoy their position. Tour was very informative and you can tell they took pride in their craft products. Would recommend going for a cocktail or the tour. Great time and great people!!

data.title: New spot in town!
data.text: I was in town with some friends visiting my dad, and we always look for fun and new things to check out! I had seen Lucidi Distillery tours on trip adviser! It was a very informative tour with amazing customer service. When we entered the distillery, we were immediately greeted by Mariah, she was very nice. She gave us the background on the building before the Lucidi's took over, how it was an old Fire Station, etc. Our tour of the distillery room was done by A.J. He was amazing, funny and very knowledgeable and encouraged the people in our tour to ask questions! During the tour you get to try three different types of spirits, vodka - gin - Canadian whiskey as well as getting one of nine different cocktails at the end of the tour! It was an amazing experience! Check it out if you're in Phoenix or surrounding areas.

data.title: New Distillery
data.text: Looked the distillery up on trip advisor and decided to check it out!! The tour was very informative, we tried three types of spirits and had a complimentary cocktail at the end of the tour. Mariah checked us in, and was awesome!!! AJ our tour guide was funny and informative as well extremely knowledgeable! Check it out if you're anywhere near Phoenix!!!

data.title: Informative
data.text: The tour was amazing. I learned a lot. Got to try samples and everything was good. Apple pie was the best. Old fire station #1 is decorated using all the old stuff from the station and done in fine taste. I really liked the lighting, all hand made.

data.title: Great Place!
data.text:
This is a distillery & bar, not a restaurant.

Fun new addition to the growing west side bar/restaurant scene,
Set in the original Peoria firehouse #1 in small old downtown area of Peoria.

They give short tours of the distillery that are quite fun and informative.
They are passionate about a long family tradition of distilling spirits.

You can book tours online on their website or call in.
Tour includes a sampling of various distilled spirits as well as a complimentary cocktail at the end of your tour.

Fun way to get in out of the sun for an hour or to kick off an evening out.
